intro: Dipteropeltis poranoides var. acutissima, commonly known as the Acute-leafed Pteropeltis, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, acute leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender peduncles. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. The varietal form acutissima is distinguished by its sharply pointed leaflets, contributing to its unique appearance.
